edmDataVersion.description: Provide a compatible upgrade version for EDM data

targetInstance.description: The server to restore it to.

databaseName.description: The name to give the restored database

owner.description: The owner of the restored database

groups.description: Array of groups to grant access to the newly created database

createDate.description: The date the database was archived or deleted

createdBy.description: the user who archived or deleted the database

sizeInMb.description: The size of the database in MB

downloadUris.description: The URIs to the archived database files

sourceUri.description: Source or exposure UUID. Required if source contract name is not present

sourceContractName.description: Source contract name. Required if source contract uuid is not present

FieldErrorsJson.description: Only and always present on draft revisions even when empty

exposureIds.description: EDM UUIDs to uniquely identify an EDM
EDM UUIDs to uniquely identify an EDM

analysisName.description: The name for the analysis with converted rates and/or losses. can only contain characters only 0-9, A-Z, a-z, underscore(_), hyphen(-), colon(:), and space. Can't start or end with hyphen, space, or colon, and can't include multiple consecutive hyphens (--)

The name for the analysis with mapped perspective. can only contain characters only 0-9, A-Z, a-z, underscore(_), hyphen(-), colon(:), and space. Can't start or end with hyphen, space, or colon, and can't include multiple consecutive hyphens (--)
Name of the final climate change analysis. Can be alpha numeric string.

climateConditionView.description: allowableValues = {Combined All Parameters, Frequency and Intensity Only, Default}

referenceRateSchemeId.description:
Rate scheme Id for a particular model. allowableValues = {190 ,202 ,84 ,9}.  
 190 ---> RMS 2019 Historical Event Rates,  
 202 ---> RMS 2021 Historical Event Rates,  
 84  ---> RMS 2015 Stochastic Event Rates,  
 9 ---> RMS v2.0 Default Rates

rcpScenario.description: RCP scenario needed for this climate change analysis. allowableValues = {2.6, 4.5, 6.0, 8.5}

timeHorizon.description:
Time Horizon for this climate change analysis. Can only be between 2020 and 2100 in 5 year increment.  
 Example - 2020, 2025, 2030, 2035, ....

type.description: The `type` attribute identifies the model type: `ExposureExportInput`, `LocationResultsExportInput`, `ResultsExportInputV2`.

exportType.description: The required `exportType` identifies the database to export: EDM, LocationResults, or RDM.

exportFormat.description: The `exportFormat` attribute specified the format of the exported data (BAK, CSV, MDF or PARQUET). EDM and RDM data modules may be exported to the BAK and MDF formats. Analysis results may be exported to the CSV or PARQUET formats. Locations results can be exported to the CSV format.

ExportOptions.description: Indicate the parts of the exposure that will be exported.
ExportOptions.example: "exportAccounts": true, "exportLocations": true, "exportPolicies": true, "exportTreaties": true, "exportReinsuranceInfo": true, "exportPerilDetailsInfo": true

sourceDatasource.description: The name of the source from which the exposure will be exported.

destinationDatasource.description: The name of the destination where the exposure will be exported.

exposureType.description: The type of exposure that will be exported.

items.description: The IDs of the exposures that will be exported.

download.description: Indicate if the EDM will be downloaded.

createnew.description: Indicate if the EDM will be newly created.

sqlVersion.description: SQL server version of exported BAK or MDF.

items.description: The Ids of the analyses that will be use for generating Location Result Export. Currently support exporting for only one analyses id.
Exported fields needed for generating of the Export Location Results file.
Financial perspectives needed for generating of the Export Location Result file.

fileName.description: The name of the file that will be generated.

items.description: Output Levels that should be saved in the result.
Financial perspectives that should be saved in the result.

createnew.description: Shows if the RDM will be newly created or not. If it's not passed, it's Set to true by default.

sqlVersion.description: SQL server version of exported BAK or MDF.

delimiter.description: the delimiter used in all files to separate columns

label.description: The unique name of the operation.

operation.description: The `operation` attribute identifies the operation model type and API to be invoked. It can be one of `geohaz`, `process` or `group`

OperationV1.description: List containing sub-jobs of the batch workflow

operation.description: The `operation` attribute identifies the operation API to be invoked.

type.description: The `type` attribute identifies the model type: `PortfolioWorkflow`, `AccountWorkflow`

name.description: The name of the batch workflow.
